transcript.text: -Lena situations presents-
-A moment of life-

-Shared with Seb-
 
I can’t not not make it. I have been waiting for this all week,
I have been waiting for this all year.
-One year earlier.-
Maybe my introduction did not need to be that  dramatic
Since our story begins in the most simple way, in Paris,
where I live and where I’m used to telling stories.
And I think that every good story starts with it’s characters.
“This is Seb, He is 25 years old and spends 95% of his time creating stuff behind his computer.
Which is fun when you know that he is the less regular youtuber of our generation.

But Seb always works in the shadows.
He disappeared for 2 month and reappeared making a freestyle while jumping from a plane at Hundreds of kilometers just to announce his new mixtape.
He is that kind of guy.
Sam Works on the other side of influence marketing. He is in advertising.
And one day he came to me to make a video in an underwater bubble in Belgium
that was the weirdest briefing I have ever received and this is when I knew we were going to be friends.
And this is Alexis. For the very first time in my youtube career,
I am not the only one to film. I hired a cameraman.
Alexis is used to the mountain and thank god he was here because
I was not always in condition to film.
And this is me
is it not too close? Absolutely not! Hmmmmm
My name is Lena, I am 23,  I make videos on the internet
and… many other things that make it difficult for me to explain my work.
But I am maybe not the first person that crosses your mind when you think of an adventurer.
Don’t worry, you are not the only one to think that.
My friend thinks exactly the same.
“You are going to climb the Kilimanjaro???”
“The Kili what?”
“Why?”
-Laughing-
“Que branlos encore”
“Why?” “Porque”

“Varum”
“Why?” “But why” "Why? “
“But b .. B..b..b… But why?
‘You are going to hang the algerian flag? “
It’s a good question ? Why ?
I don’t really have answers to give to you.
Except maybe that I walk every morning,
comes rain, wind or snow.
I call this walk "the morning walk of this morning".
Every morning I make a long walk to get my morning refresha

“Thank you”
But that just an excuse to help me start the day slowly before my phone rings
and drags me into the downward spiral “ Zoom, whatsapp, twitter, insta, tik tok,mail, Zoom, whatsapp, twitter, insta, tik tok,mail,”
I like it because I am alone with my thoughts.
And when I give her room, the voice in my head always proposes to me very cool ideas
I would not have thought of while being into the spiral.
And the only problem is that at 9 AM I have to go back to work
but sometimes the voice in my head has not finished yet.
I needed a long walk.
And as simple as it looks, the Kilimanjaro crew was created
The only thing that was complicated was the preparation
because you will see in this video that the mountain is not our friend.

And that you should not try the Kilimandjaro without preparation.
60
00:03:27--> 00:03:29
Chapter 1
- How do we prepare? -

- The equipment -
Adidas just rang the doorbell with all the equipment. How can we carry all of this ?
I feel like it will be cold, there are down jackets, underpants, gaiters.
Do you remember what gaiters are ? I used to wear gaiters to look like the girls in “Shake it up”.
Now I’m wearing gaiters to climb a mountain!
Uh… How are we going to do it?
There are things planned for the rain but also for the heat.
It just looks like the paper clip that appeared on Word saying "hey! :)”
Oh fuck you are exactly like the trombone
Why are there so many things?
Well it's simple. It's because the Kilimanjaro is made of different sequences:
in low altitude it's hot, we are in a tropical climate.
The more we go up, the colder it is, so we must be equipped in consequence.
Where am I?
It has to be a hood, right?
Although it looks like a Sims that dresses in random mode, it is really not the thing to do.
Because as the trombone said, we will go through very different climates.
And, I’m not gonna lie, we don’t climb mountains every day… so, we don't have the right clothes.
So, I called Adidas and, you know, we've been working together for a year
on some really cool projects (and I can tell you they're pretty cool guys)
That's why I knew they would be crazy enough to follow me in my project
After all, they say: “Impossible is nothing”

Suitcase : check
83
00:05:03-->00:05:05
On the health side, you must be vaccinated against yellow fever.
And of course… - PCR TEST - When ? Tomorrow.

- THE NEXT DAY -
Do you know them ?
I don’t know who they are.
Of course, with my ability to think that I can do everything in my days, as if they were 50 hours each,
I went to Disneyland for a week-end with my friends right before Kilimanjaro.
However, I think that Disneyland is a good place to practice walking.
I'm putting on my hiking boots for the first time and will spend the weekend wearing them,
so I don't get blisters later. Do you like my swagg ? No
I mean, it’s not that bad, with flared pants, it gives you a style.

Getting used to my shoes : Check
95
00:05:48-->00:05:50
I’m walking in your apartment because I didn’t have time to get used to my shoes.
I’ll be doing this until 5 AM.
We have to be at the airport in 4 hours. I don't feel ready but I can't wait to leave!
Did you manage to pass the cocaine?
No but I managed to come with my 9mm.
Fun fact : This is where we first met.
Some literature for the trip.
- PARIS // AMSTERDAM -
We are in Amsterdam for a few minutes.
- AMSTERDAM // KILIMANJARO
We are in Tanzanie !!
I love this “Where's Waldo” game. Where is your suitcase?
There’s something that I find magical when I travel by night.
The surprise effect lasts longer. You have to wait for the sunrise in order to see where you truly are.
Hello!
Hello?
Have you ever seen a bed made like this?

Oh, it looks like a mountain!
No, the top of Kilimanjaro is flat!
Yes, but they are doing as they can with sheets… It’s not bad at all
The suitcases will remain here for 10 days
and it is here that we spend our first night before everything starts, tomorrow.
F*ck, there’s a mosquito in the net!
It’s like we just invited him to have a coffee with us, except the coffee is us.
Guys, there is no going back, we are in Tanzania.
And let me introduce you to the one we came to meet : Mount Kilimanjaro,
the highest mountain in Africa. Higher than Mont Blanc. 5 891 m, which is like 18 Eiffel Towers.
Right before our very eyes.
I didn't want to wake up this morning. Not because of the tiredness but because I was scared.
If I wake up it’s getting real, I will have to do it.
I’m happy, right now!
Now that you know the mountain,
let me introduce you to the man who made this adventure possible.
Our guide Johnny.

Since 1991, it’s impossible to climb up Mount Kilimanjaro alone. It’s too dangerous.
130
00:08:25-->00:08:27
It’s obligatory to take a local team to clim up.
And Trust me, you are going to love Johnny, cause it’s him, the real hero of this adventure.
The “gate” is the starting point. At least, the starting point of our route.
There are many harder and easier ways, like levels in a video game. Let me explain.
You have to know Kilimanjaro is 5891m tall.
And you don't climb a mountain like you climb a table…
I’m small.
There are seven different ways to reach the summit.
The three more important ones are :
The Marangu route, the simplest, fastest, most comfortable one. It is even equipped with shelters.
Guides call it the

Coca-Cola way, because it is mostly Americans who chose it. Cheers
142
00:09:30->00:09:35
Then, the Machame route, harder but shorter. It takes only five or six days to go through all of it.
And last but not least, the Lemosho route, longer, wilder, less touristy.
Seven days of ascent without any refuge.
I let you guess which one we chose (the longest).
The guide is like the main teacher at the beginning of the school year,
when you keep your fingers crossed for the nice teacher.
even if they all look cool, maybe some of them are less patient than others
He looked extremely cool and, as the guide is going to be with us on the whole climb,
And we can do nothing without him, it's cool that there’s a good connection between us.
Last suit check
I will show you our shower for the next ten days…

Wipes! So… This is our shower now.
154
00:10:57->00:10:59
- Chapter 2 -
- The adventure begins -
Well, I have some bad news.
We went to buy some sim cards but our passports are not linked to something
that makes us not entitled to our phone. So, for ten days, we will not have access to our phones.
It means we are cut off from the rest of the world.
Makes you sad?
No… A little bit… Sad isn’t the word. Trembling because of the pressure, I would say.
But ten days... What about your son?
When you come back, he’ll have become a teenager!
I've never spent so much time without my phone.
There could be the end of the world, we wouldn't know about it!
I don't even know what Rihanna wore to the Met gala!

Well, behind this unbearable character of the influencer who can't imagine life without her phone,
159
00:12:03,000 --> 00:12:02,000
There is a little bit of truth.
I have a real addiction to my phone
Sure, it's my work tool, but that doesn't explain the 3 hours of screen time per day on TikTok.
And the hours lost watching gorgeous girls’ lives on Instagram
10days. I think the last time I went 10 days without my phone was in 8th grade when my mom grounded me for running away and hanging out with the cool guys in school.
Anyway, after the August vlogs, I've overdosed on social networks. This break will do me good.
Even if it means I won't make an IG story of my lunch dish.
Oh no, I just dropped my chicken on the floor…
There's gravel on it… I was holding it and it suddenly disappeared!
He shouted “Freedom!��
Well… I'm going to eat my chicken that just fell on the floor
There’s a stone in here!
We hear a bus in the distance, it’s Johnny’s team
While preparing for our climbing, we realized that it was much more regulated than we thought,
Each group is accompanied by at least one guide and 3 to 4 carriers per walker
We have no right to carry our camp and our provisions alone and in any case
In any case we would have been unable to do it without them
tents, mattresses, sleep… sleeping bags.
She mispronounced sleeeeeeping bags!
And food, as you can see with this little piece of meat sticking out.
Our bags are weighed and so are those of the team, nothing must exceed 20kg,
Then all those rules are obviously for economic reasons, this create jobs,
But it is also and especially for the safety of hikers, because we have not mentioned the dangers yet but they are real
Many people die each year on Mount Kilimanjaro.
I can’t die before I take a picture with Chris Jenner.
So we’re gonna stay careful and follow the rules.
The first step! Only one billion left.
Everything stings! It stings me!
Nevermind, this is my hair.
- Day 1,
3 hours of walk
in the jungle -
Oh, oh, oh!
I really like them
You know what my first love disappointment was? Was when I learned that marsupilami did not exist.
We come with the sun.
I’m so happy we just arrived!
- Shower time -
Are you happy ?
Very happy !
You make me a room tour ? The closet, the dressing
And here we have the office. To read and write
It’s very cold
My sexy pyjama !
the people who accompany us, I have never faced so much kindness to the point where we are uncomfortable
There is some hot chocolate, peanut butter, honey, and coffee. We are gooood
The Kili is so well accompanied by, they are so adorable, we literally do nothing
- We “play” facetime - I’m doing good, and you?
Hi!
Now you can look at this video and we can talk to it.
Boredom pushes you to be…
Imaginative! Yep
Can we say it, “imaginative”? Nop
Was it funny or are we just tired? Because I think it wasn’t so funny.

*and every night Johnny wouldn't let us go to sleep without taking our blood pressure*
221
00:16:34-->00:16:35
Are my glasses not there?
I don't understand, I had them on me a minute ago!
F*ckkkk I've been looking for them for an hour!
The most important part of the day: we have to drink 3 to 4 liters of water a day.
Because we get dehydrated without realizing it. And we don’t want to… To die!
Let’s go! Day two, day two, day two!
Do you feel good?
Sure and you?
Yep, I’m ok! I slept well.
Shall we go ?
I dreamed of the internet,
I had 3 wifi bars then 4, 5
and I went up to 1000!
It took up so much space that it killed everyone
- DAY 2 -
Johnny told us that the second day was the most complicated.
We didn't really understand at first.
Since we were under the shade of trees, we found that rather simple!

After 2 hours of walking, we left the jungle for a more rocky setting.
It was at this moment that our body reminded us
that we were not in a good physical shape.
And, from then, we started to have a hard time.
The trees that used to provide shade are no longer there!
It's hard, it's hard...
I'm not going to lie, I'm having zero fun.
And you know me, I wanted to enjoy it, for the sake of the video,
and do something super positive.
But honestly, I just wanted to go back to Paris.
The hardest part for me is the climbing… It's like I’m climbing a ski slope.

Let’s go…
We have 4 hours of walking left.
Well, 4 hours, that's what Johnny told us not to discourage us.
I can’t climb anymore…
give us some flat land!
Imagine that we could live the same thing, but under a torrent of rain.

True.
That's it, everybody's feeling better!

I hope there will be a voice over :
Don’t forget, +=+!
Do you want to draw "+=+" in the snow?
No! At first “+=+” was a little thing just for me and it went out of control
Johnny explains to us the "polé polé" which means "gently gently" in Swahili.
Because it is impossible to go fast in this mountain.
He explains to us that the French who come can’t walk slowly.
I wanted to move fast
because, in my mind, the faster you walk, the faster you get to your destination.

It’s rather logical, isn’t it?
Except that you won’t get to the top

because your body will be exhausted before you achieve it.
269
00:19:17-->00:19:18
One more hour of walking…
Walking is all we do!

So…
Polé polé.
Look, we just arrived above the clouds!
It feels good, we were only walking without seeing where we were!

Now, we are above the clouds!
We are coming!

- Walking hours: twelve -
269
00:20:33,000 --> 00:20:32,000
Yeyo yeyo yeyo
It’s “yeyo”, right?
Yeyo yeyo yeyo yeyo yeyo

We are at 3600 meters.
Once we arrived at the top,
as if the last eight hours of walking were not already intense enough,
We tasted for the first time the acute pain of the mountains.
This is clearly the main danger because there can be serious complications,
sometimes fatal.

At altitude, the atmospheric pressure decreases.
279
-20:-31:-23,-648 --> 00:21:17,000
Since the beginning of the video,
you can see me crying and being in a lot of pain,
but the other two guys...
Look at samuel.

I am dying...
I want to vomit and shit at the same time…

You have to evacuate.
Yeah, I need to evacuate something.
Airsickness makes your neck feel heavy.
The whole effect of the altitude hits me in the head.
There is less oxygen than down there.
Except that your body is used to the oxygen down there!
And when it receives less,
it reacts very badly.
Why do people say that we breathe better in the mountains
when it is not true?
There is no more oxygen in the air!

My mother, when we went skiing,
would say "Ah what a nice place to breathe!".
I think it depends on the altitude of the mountain.
People must die, here!

Some people die every year, yes…
I find it very dangerous.
We wait for your body to get used to it.
And when we get used to it, we go higher.
That's what this climb is all about.

Once he gets used to it, it's done.
The altitude sickness does not make me want to eat.
Headaches, dizziness, nausea, loss of appetite and hallucinations.
I didn't really believe in hallucinations.
Until the night fell
and I found myself facing the stars.
In the light of Paris, it's rare that I find myself facing them.
I was sleeping,

and I heard them calling me.
So, I got out of the tent and sat down on a rock.
I started to tell them about my condition,
and they answered me.
They motivated me to continue the adventure
and to realize how lucky I was to be here.
Yes, I know I didn't really talk to the stars,
I was just totally stoned from lack of oxygen,
but I think it's pretty poetic!
Let's just say that the stars lulled
and motivated me before going to bed.
Hello! It is our second night,

we are very high,
we had some altitude sickness but we’re good now!

The tent froze
Yea, the tent is frozen
How is the acclimatization? Perfect
I mean, yesterday I was talking to the stars…
Let’s brush our teeth!
- DAY 3 -
Right now I’m feeling super good,
but I might feel like shit in about two hours.
- TWO HOURS LATER -
-WITHOUT ANY SURPRISE -
We’ve been walking for like 1000 years, that’s getting on my nerves.
It feels like the time doesn’t pass here.
For our defense, one of the symptoms of mountain
sickness is the bad mood that eats up your morale.
But, you know, Johnny has all the answers.
As soon as he feels that the team's morale is falling,
he pulls out his secret weapon: the Kilimanjaro song.
“Hello

Hello, sir
How are you doing ?
I’m doing very well
Visitors
Visitors
You are welcome
Kilimanjaro
No worries”
And it works everytime!
Ermmm… We’re only walking, actually.
- Acclimatization is complete -
I'm happy because I wasn't enjoying the first two days at all
and I was mad at myself for not liking it
because it's my project and my dream,
and I wanted us to really do it!
Now that I'm acclimated, it's fascinating.
My body is like, "okay I'm good here!"
It's a shame to come to Tanzania,
in the most beautiful landscape I've ever seen,
and to not like it just because I was not in a good shape.
There is a small river and small things,
we saw an antelope passing by

It feels like we’re in a dream
What the hell are we doing here?
I feel like I can get the shot back for the video,
because I couldn't even vlog earlier.
I couldn't hold my camera, I couldn't move... And now it's good!
We're playing Dune (the movie).
Can you see this? It’s not fog, it’s not smoke…

It’s clouds!
One of my biggest disappointments in my life was when
I learned that the clouds were not like in the Kinder commercial,
where the girl lies on the cloud.
LIAR
Look, these are lucky stones.
They put this to wish good luck to the next people who’ll pass by.
So, we have to add a stone.
- Good luck! -
- DAY 3 - 9 HOURS OF WALKING -
After 9 hours of walking,
we see where we are going to sleep tonight.
We can see Seb peeing as well.

Finally, we can see Seb peeing!
Honestly, we suffer a lot
but once you arrive at the camp,

you are so happy to have succeeded in doing it
and Miss Nature
tells you "go have a little fun"
by offering you this magical landscape.
I know that you’ve been asking yourself a small question since the beginning of the video,

but that you don't dare to ask it.
Where are the toilets?
There is a toilet tent.
Pee is ok, poo is a no.

You can find this on some camps :
It's disgusting, there is a kind of septic hole
in which all the shit has been stacked for thousands of years.
Or you can do it behind a bush.
In this case, there is a code name.
When we want to relieve ourselves,

we say "let's go get the monkeys."
Have you found any monkeys?

- DAY 4 -
It is 6:20am, the day begins.
As soon as we wake up we have to get ready and get dressed.
You can't go out in your pajamas anyway.
We’re becoming very good at undoing a tent.
We wake up at 6am and we have to be gone an hour later.
We prepare our bags,
making sure that they are not too heavy,
even if they still are a little.
Water is essential.
Just shut up and carry it so you can drink later.
I’m very surprised about my body.
How come he knows how to do that?
I didn’t know he could do that!
Mahfouf's little overconfidence
until I see what Johnny has prepared for us today.
We're going to climb the mountain.
I mean, we won't really climb it because we're not goats,
but we'll follow this path.
Usually, when you walk and there is a mountain in front of you, you go around it.
Now, there is a mountain right in front of us, and we are going to climb it!
Dora would have told us to take the side path!
Wait, what ? No no no no no. I can’t.
That’s clearly climbing.
Look! You make one wrong move and it's over.

One wrong move and you're on the other side...
… and not of the mountain.
Yea…
You know that I'm afraid of heights, right?
This rock is called the “kissing rock”
because you can't pass without kissing it!
You didn't kiss it!

Oh, hi!
There we go!
- MEANWHILE -
I think it is the worst experience of my life.

I hate you, Lena.
There, we realize that

Sam was hiding something from us.
I have kids!!!!
The team's dad
is afraid of heights.
There are only vertical rocks…
- WE ARE AT 5000 METERS ALTITUDE -
Please answer, Mom!
It's 8:30, you’re waking her up

Hello?
Hello Mom?
Hi! I’m so glad to hear from you!
I'm on a mountain, and I just wanted to tell you that I'm alive
and I’m at 5000 meters altitude!
Wow wow! I’m so happy for you!
Enjoy this moment, for me, keep me in your thoughts!
Kisses! Kisses!
It was my mom.
I have to keep her in my thoughts!
I put my phone back in airplane mode,
I think I paid 1000 euros for that one minute phone call.
You'll bill me for it!
- DAY 4 - 6 HOURS OF WALKING -
THE CAMP
And just like that, we climbed a mountain together,
which seemed impossible earlier.
Th… That… That… That’s clearly climbing.
Us, who were in this physical state two days ago, because of altitude sickness.
You see, that's what we call the second wind.
This is what gave us confidence for the last day, before the big climb.
Let day 5 begin!
It is 5:30 am!!! Good morning!
I woke up at 2am with the urge to pee.
I peed in my bottle but I was high and had a bad aim
so I peed next to the bottle for like two seconds.
It soiled me and made me very sad…
Wait, you peed on yourself? … Hahaha
- DAY 5 -
- 4 HOURS OF WALKING -
I like my body a lot more now than before we started to go up.
I used to not care about my body.

But now, I love it!
It’s super strong!
My good thighs are useful!
True, that’s truly impressive.
The difference between day two and today, now you outrun us!
Only 4 hours of walking today,
but it is in order to be prepared for the big climb.
The last steps are the hardest.
In the meantime, we spend time with the boys!
- LAST MEETING BEFORE THE ASCENT -
Here we are,
after all these efforts,
today we will be on the highest mountain of Africa.
We wake up at 11pm for a midnight start.
For the first time, we walked at night.
The only problem is that I haven't slept
and I was afraid of the hardship that awaited us.
They say that when you think too much about a problem,
you live it twice, and it’s exactly what’s happening.
Are you okay?
I am out of phase, biphasic,
leap. 11pm… It’s not a time to wake-up, it’s a time to sleep!
- hot tea -
I want it to burn me!
Burn me!
What I didn't mention is that,

at night and at this time of the day,
518
00:35:04-->00:35:06
the temperature is -15°C.
We are at 4800 meters of altitude,
which is the height of Mont Blanc
and we have to go 1000 meters higher.
And we have only 5 or 6 hours to climb it.
We are doing very little steps.
We’ll get there! We’ll get there.
I think I won’t make it.

Low morale?
Yes…
You can do it, Lena!
I was thinking that my morale was falling down,
but it was actually my body.
I'm getting hypotensive.
I can’t stand up, my eyes are closing by themselves,
and I am literally freezing.
We’ve been walking for more than 4 hours,
and I can’t feel my feet anymore.
I wish I could do it…
You will make it!
Yes…
I’m not so sure.
I don’t know if I’ll be able to climb.
My physical condition is starting to worry everyone,
especially Johnny who told us about the risks involved.
And he doesn't want to take any risk.
He takes my blood pressure.
I am 54, whereas the day before, I was 90.
My blood pressure is good! And you?
I don’t know if you will believe me,
but from that moment on, I can’t remember anything.
This is one of the symptoms but I’m discovering this video as you’re discovering it.
I only remember voices talking to me.
You are not the only one, I don't feel well either
Not everyone can do it, that's how it is
But when I go back to Paris everyone will tell me about it

Look, look.
Your message is “polé polé”.
Your message is no longer “you must succeed”.
It isn’t anymore.
You said it yourself, that it was harmful.
Don't go back to your harmful ways.
I can’t do it…
I’ve been waiting for it for a week…
I’ve been waiting for it for a year.
How can we euh… Can we… Fuck...
I can’t speak english!

Seb wants me to come back down
because he is worried about my blood pressure.
We can start again,
try to catch your breath.
If you feel that you can't do it,
It means that it's impossible.
You’re beginning to know the character.
I spoke with the voice in my head,
and waved to my friends the stars.
I concentrated
and we kept walking.
You’re maybe wondering why we have to do it by night,
when the temperature is that low?
It is simply to have a nice view at the arrival,
and incidentally the beautiful Instagram photo.
The problem is that we lost a lot of time.
And when the sun came up,
we didn't look like this.
Nope, we were still walking
and we had to walk for 4 hours
to get to the top of the Kilimanjaro.
- 4 HOURS LEFT
- LAZINESS -
There's something going on in your brain when, for the past 7 days,
we've been telling you about the most beautiful sunrise you'll ever see.
Obviously, you are a little disappointed.
This is so beautiful…
Do you realize how much we've climbed?
It's unbelievable.
I have left my tears there.
You even made me cry.

Really?
Well done guys, well done us.
Deception sometimes leads you to the greatest stupidity.
We tend to think it's over.

This is the last feeling,
a dead end of feeling.
We thought that the last step of the journey was disappointment.
We were so desperate for comfort
that we decided to give up,
and to go back down.
After the week that we just spent,

all the efforts,
the tears, the laughter,
the thousands of steps, a few meters from the finish,
we give up.
We don't care about the highest mountain in Africa,
We want a bed and a Coke.
And we’re feeling like it’s a good idea.
We announce it to Johnny: "we stop here, we’re good, kisses!"
We go back down for 20 minutes.
Johnny distances us,
we see him in the distance and we see him crying.
At that moment, we think to ourselves:
“Are we that dumb? Goddamn it!”
The guides are not paid more if we make it to the top,
but it was just important to him.
Because even if we did not always believe in ourselves,
there is one who always supported us.

And it is Johnny.
So, yeah… We will climb this f*cking mountain!
I gave seven days of my life, fighting,
only to come back to Paris and look at myself in the mirror to say:
"I didn't even go all the way".
Let’s go…It sucks, it really sucks!
Unfortunately, we feel that we are losing a soldier:
Samuel can’t follow anymore because of his heart.
Johnny leaves him no choice but to go back down.
Too risky for him.
Only Seb and I
are left for the last few meters.
I knew it was important to do it, though

Yes
It was necessary to go all the way, for everyone
I don't know what state we arrived in, but we arrived!
I’m so happy!!!

Unbelievable!
I feel like I'm on a show,
look what we just did, holy shit!
We are at Mount Kilimanjaro!
That's a great achievement
and a great moral!
We thought about giving up several times but we didn't give up!
Even if we really struggled…
I started youtube
when I discovered travel vlogs.
I thought it was crazy to see different landscapes
while lying in my bed after school
or on my lunch break at work
That was my dream at the age of 17.
I wanted to take people on a journey
and inspire them by telling a story through a screen.
And I've made plenty of travel videos.
If I learned one thing by climbing this mountain,
that I didn't learn anywhere else,
it's that it's not really about the summit.
It's the steps of those who accompany us,
those who joke with us to make us forget the fatigue,
those who worry when we stumble,
or just the steps of those who walk silently beside us.
Those who make us take a small step further
when we want to turn back,
and those who force us to catch our breath
and look at the landscape.
I don't know if you needed to hear this message today,
but it's the one that sticks in my head:
Polé polé, you’ll make it.
Let’s take a picture, now!
Oh my god, a shower!
And a real bed!

Ouch, the aches...
 
So, now we have to go all the way down?
 
A slide or a zip line should have been installed!
